info.title: ThreatCase DEF456
summary: On May 15, tsmith-desktop began querying a higher than expected number of machines via ICMP, PTR, and data ports.
Between May 16-20, tsmith-desktop and eprindle-notebook collected data from dbserver01, dbserver02, and dbserver03.
Between May 17-21, tsmith-desktop exfiltrated an unusual amount of data to google.com and dropbox.com.

events.desc: tsmith-desktop queried 6 hosts, including suspicious host eprindle-notebook, using 6 ports of interest: 22, 137, 139, 389, 443, and 445

lists.title: Timeframe: Expected Activity
bullets: Within the 7 day window, tsmith-desktop queried 6 distinct hosts (including eprindle-notebook) using data ports 22, 137, 139, 389, 443, and 445.
tsmith-desktop typically contacts hosts on 443 only

lists.title: Peer Based Explanations
bullets: tsmith-desktop is in user VLAN segment (10.50.60.0/24)
tsmith-desktop has not communicated with any of these IP's within the previous time window

evidence.desc: tsmith-desktop spoke to 90 hosts, including suspicious host eprindle-notebook, using the ICMP protocol.
tsmith-desktop made reverse DNS lookups (PTR requests) to dbserver01 and dbserver02.

events.desc: tsmith-desktop spoke to 90 hosts, including suspicious host eprindle-notebook, using the ICMP protocol.

Source typically contacts 0 hosts via ICMP

tsmith-desktop made reverse DNS lookups (PTR requests) to dbserver01 and dbserver02.

events.desc: tsmith-desktop made reverse DNS lookups (PTR requests) to learn about dbserver01 and dbserver02.

tsmith-desktop spoke to 90 hosts, including suspicious host eprindle-notebook, using the ICMP protocol.

info.title: ThreatCase ABC123
summary: From May 12th to May 19th, BreakRoom_PC began querying more machines than normal via ICMP. Then BsmithSpec1_PC (queried by BreakRoom_PC) collected data from OrcIDB5, which resides on a separate VLAN.
Then Acme DC03 sent 52.9MB of data to Plexipr.com, which has been identified as a suspicious domain.

related: BreakRoom_PC subsequently received 63KB from these hosts.

events.desc: BreakRoom_PC collected 5.9 MB from BsmithSpec1_PC via port 445.
BsmithSpec1_PC collected 14 KB from BreakRoom_PC via port 139.
BreakRoom_PC published 5.9MB to highmark.net via port 80.
AcmeDC03 collected 67 KB from BsmithSpec1_PC via port 139.
BsmithSpec1_PC collected 25 MB from AcmeDC03 via port 445.
AcmeDC03 collected 1.39 GB from OrclDB5 via port 139.
AcmeDC03 published 52.9 MB to plexipr.com via port 443.

info.title: ThreatCase JKL012
summary: On July 1, alex-desktop performed a network sweep using ICMP and identified multiple active hosts.
On July 2, alex-desktop and mike-laptop began data extraction from dbserverA and dbserverB.
On July 3, alex-desktop sent extracted data to yahoo.com and amazonaws.com.

events.desc: alex-desktop identified 8 active hosts using ICMP sweeps.
alex-desktop collected 500 MB from dbserverA over port 1521 (Oracle DB).

info.title: ThreatCase MNO345
summary: On August 1, charlie-desktop started scanning a wide range of subnets using multiple ports.
Between August 2-5, charlie-desktop and emily-laptop began transferring data from various database servers.
On August 6, charlie-desktop uploaded data to multiple cloud storage services.

events.desc: charlie-desktop started scanning 10 hosts using multiple ports.
emily-laptop collected 200 MB from dbserver05 over port 1521 (Oracle DB).
charlie-desktop collected 300 MB from dbserver06 over port 1433 (SQL Server).

info.title: ThreatCase PQR678
summary: On September 1, compromised-desktop started scanning a network segment using port 80 and port 443.
Between September 2-4, compromised-desktop and infected-laptop began transferring data between themselves and multiple internal servers.
On September 5, compromised-desktop uploaded data to an external cloud storage service.

events.desc: infected-laptop collected 200 MB from dbserver10 over port 1521 (Oracle DB).

info.title: ThreatCase STU901
summary: On October 1, compromised-desktop and infected-laptop started extensive recon activities across multiple network segments.
Between October 2-9, they continued to scan and query various internal hosts using multiple ports.
On October 10, compromised-desktop uploaded collected data to an external cloud storage service.

info.title: ThreatCase VWX234
summary: On November 1, compromised-desktop started extensive recon activities across a large group of internal hosts.
Between November 2-9, compromised-desktop began pulling data from multiple internal servers.
On November 10, compromised-desktop uploaded collected data to an external host in Russia.

events.desc: compromised-desktop started scanning 1000 hosts using multiple ports.
compromised-desktop collected 250 MB from dbserver02 over port 1521 (Oracle DB).

info.title: ThreatCase YZA345
summary: On December 1, employee-laptop began performing network scans across internal hosts using ICMP.
Between December 2-5, employee-laptop collected data from several internal servers.
On December 6, employee-laptop began uploading the collected data to a suspicious external host.

events.desc: employee-laptop performed network scans on 50 hosts using ICMP.

info.title: ThreatCase BCD678
summary: On November 1, compromised-laptop began recon activities across multiple network segments using various ports.
Between November 2-10, compromised-laptop collected data from several internal servers.
On November 11-14, compromised-laptop established multiple exfiltration channels to different external hosts.

events.desc: compromised-laptop performed network scans on 100 hosts using ICMP.
compromised-laptop performed port scans on 100 hosts using ports 80 and 443.
compromised-laptop collected 300 MB from dbserver02 over port 1521 (Oracle DB).

info.title: ThreatCase EFG789
summary: An insider with access privileges, malicious-employee, pulled specific sensitive data from internal servers.
Between December 2-6, malicious-employee exfiltrated the collected data to an external shady domain.

events.desc: malicious-employee accessed and collected 50 MB of HR data from hrserver01 over port 1433 (SQL).
malicious-employee accessed and collected 75 MB of financial data from financeserver01 over port 1433 (SQL).
malicious-employee accessed and collected 100 MB of legal documents from legalserver01 over port 1433 (SQL).
malicious-employee uploaded 50 MB of HR data to shadydomain.com over port 443 (HTTPS).
malicious-employee uploaded 75 MB of financial data to shadydomain.com over port 443 (HTTPS).
malicious-employee uploaded 100 MB of legal documents to shadydomain.com over port 443 (HTTPS).
malicious-employee uploaded an additional 25 MB of miscellaneous data to shadydomain.com over port 443 (HTTPS).
